title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Rennie N (2022). PrettyCols: Pretty colour palettes. R package version 0.0.2, https://nrennie.github.io/PrettyCols/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PrettyCols: Pretty colour palettes},   author = {Nicola Rennie},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.2},   url = {https://nrennie.github.io/PrettyCols/}, }

title: Pretty colour palettes
text: {PrettyCols} R package containing aesthetically pleasing colour palettes. structure package based code {PNWColors}, {wesanderson}, {MetBrewer} packages.

title: Pretty colour palettes
Pretty colour palettes
code: prettycols("MoodyBlues", n = 7, type = "discrete") prettycols("MoodyBlues", n = 100, type = "continuous")

title: Pretty colour palettes
code: library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(type = c("A", "B", "C"),                   value = c(1, 2, 3)) ggplot(data = df,         mapping = aes(x = type, y = value, fill = type)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_pretty_d(name = "MoodyBlues")

title: Complete list of palettes. — PrettyColsPalettes
text: Use names(PrettyColsPalettes) return palette names. Current choices : MoodyBlues

title: Complete list of palettes. — PrettyColsPalettes
Complete list of palettes. — PrettyColsPalettes
Generates the colour palettes — prettycols
Generates the colour palettes — prettycols
Generates the colour palettes — prettycols
text: name Name Palette. Choices : MoodyBlues n Number desired colors. number requested colors beyond scope palette, colors automatically interpolated. n provided, length palette used. type Either "continuous" "discrete". Use continuous want automatically interpolate colors. Default "discrete" direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed
